                    </div><div class="st_content_txt">
                        <div class="st_content_txt_tm" id="147344">
                            <span>127、</span>
                            <em>[单选]</em>
                            一个团队没有完成承诺的工作。看板上的卡片没有移动，燃尽图显示冲刺的进展缓慢。敏捷项目经理应该怎么做？A team is not delivering the committed work. Cards are not moving on the kanban board, and the burndown chart shows that the sprint progress is slow. What should the agile project manager do?                        </div>
                        <div class="st_content_txt_xx">
                            <ul>
                                <li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> A：考虑使用其他绩效指标。Consider the use of alternative performance metrics.                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> B：更改在制品（WIP）限制以反映团队的能力。Change the work in progress (WIP) limit to reflect the team's capacity.                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> C：与高级领导讨论绩效问题。Discuss the performance with senior leadership.                                    </li><li>
                                        <input type="radio" checked=""> D：与交付任务缓慢的项目团队成员会面。Meet with the project team members who are slow in delivering tasks.                                                                                </li>                            </ul>
                        </div>

                    </div><div class="st_content_txt">
                        <div class="st_content_txt_tm" id="147345">
                            <span>128、</span>
                            <em>[单选]</em>
                            一名项目经理正在为一家初创公司工作。该公司通过学习平台启动了基于云的敏捷项目管理和DevOps培训模块，以支持多种自学和虚拟学习格式。在最近的一个冲刺，质量保证团队未能彻底检查模块就部署了，导致了糟糕的客户体验。项目经理面临的是以下哪一个问题？A project manager is working on a project for a startup company. The company launched cloud-based agile project management and DevOps training modules via the learning platform to support multiple self-paced and virtual learning formats. In a recent sprint, the quality assurance team failed to thoroughly inspect the modules before deployment, resulting in a poor customer experience. Which of the following issues is the project manager facing?                        </div>
                        <div class="st_content_txt_xx">
                            <ul>
                                <li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> A：不符合问题。Nonconformance issue.                                    </li><li>
                                        <input type="radio" checked=""> B：逃逸缺陷。Escaped defect.                                                                                </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> C：未达到计划完成比率。Unmet planned-to-done ratio.                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> D：未检测到的错误。Undetected error.                                    </li>                            </ul>
                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_answer">
                            <span>正确答案：<span class="answer_right">B</span></span>
                            <span>你的答案：<span class="answer_wrong">B</span></span>
                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_jx_txt">
                            解析：选B，逃逸缺陷指的是在产品发布或部署后才被发现的缺陷，即这些缺陷在质量保证过程中未被检测到，导致产品在交付给最终用户后出现问题。在这个情况中，由于质量保证团队未能彻底检查培训模块就进行了部署，导致最终用户体验不佳，这明显属于逃逸缺陷的案例。选项A：不符合问题通常是指产品或服务不符合预定的标准或要求。选项C：未达到计划完成比率指的是完成的工作量与计划中的工作量之间的比例不一致，这与质量问题无直接关系。选项D：未检测到的错误虽然接近于逃逸缺陷，但逃逸缺陷更专业地描述了这种情况，特别是在软件开发和部署的语境中。                                                    </div>
                    </div><div class="st_content_txt">
                        <div class="st_content_txt_tm" id="147346">
                            <span>129、</span>

                        <div class="st_content_txt_xx">
                            <ul>
                                <li>
                                        <input type="radio" checked=""> A：关注矫正问题而非仅仅纠正表面症状。Focus on remediation not merely on correcting symptoms.                                                                                </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> B：将团队的表现与其他项目团队进行比较。Compare the team's performance against other project teams.                                    </li><li>

                    </div><div class="st_content_txt">
                        <div class="st_content_txt_tm" id="147347">
                            <span>130、</span>
                            <em>[单选]</em>
                            一家公司正在启动一个有严格截止日期的关键项目。在第一次计划会议期间，团队意识到需求清单中的条目太多，无法按时交付。项目经理应该首先做什么？A company is starting a critical project with a strict deadline.                             <ul>

                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> A：更新风险登记册，并提出应急计划，以在截止日期前完成。Update the risk register and present a contingency plan to meet the deadline.                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> B：建议客户减少待办事项，以满足日期要求。Suggest to the customer to reduce the backlog to meet the date.                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> C：提高团队按时完成项目的能力。Increase the capacity of the team to finish the project on time.                                    </li><li>

                        <div class="jxxq_answer">

                        <div class="jxxq_jx_txt">

                    </div><div class="st_content_txt">
                        <div class="st_content_txt_tm" id="147348">
                            <span>131、</span>

                            <ul>

                                        <input type="radio" checked=""> B：与团队分享组织的决策，并制定在即将到来的项目中采用敏捷方法的计划。Share the organization's decision with the team and make plans to adopt an agile approach in the upcoming project.                                                                                </li><li>

                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> D：请项目发起人变更回预测方法，因为这是小组的长处。Ask the project sponsor to change the approach back to predictive as that is the team's strength.                                    </li>                            </ul>

                            <span>正确答案：<span class="answer_right">B</span></span>
                            <span>你的答案：<span class="answer_wrong">B</span></span>
                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_jx_txt">
                            解析：本题考查生命周期的选择。既然组织决定转型，采用敏捷的方式，项目经理作为组织的一份子，应该支持组织的决定，并且学习和适应新的模式，也是很不错的做法，因此本题的最佳实践为B选项。A选项，这是在规划阶段需要做的事情，而不是启动前。C选项，是A选项之后，进行分析后可能会采取的措施，但还是更优先给没有敏捷经验的团队成员申请培训。D选项，组织所决定的大趋势，不可逆，应该支持组织的决定。                                                    </div>
                    </div><div class="st_content_txt">
                        <div class="st_content_txt_tm" id="147349">
                            <span>132、</span>
                            <em>[单选]</em>
                            在执行阶段，项目经理发现可交付物没有达到主要干系人所要求的质量规格。这导致进度绩效指数（SPI）从0.98下降到0.72，成本绩效指数（CPI）从1.5下降到1.1。项目经理应该采取什么行动来缓解可交付物在下一次迭代中被拒绝的问题？During the execution phase, the project manager discovered that the deliverables are not meeting the quality specifications requested by the main stakeholder.                         <div class="st_content_txt_xx">
                            <ul>
                                <li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> A：提交变更请求，按质量问题的解决方案的优先级排序，以将对其余可交付物的影响最小化。Submit a change request to prioritize resolutions for the quality issue to minimize the impact on the rest of the deliverables.                                    </li><li>
                                        <input type="radio" checked=""> B：在冲刺计划期间加强完成的定义（DoD），以便团队对预期有共同的理解。Reinforce the definition of done (DoD) during sprint planning so that the team has a common understanding of expectations.                                                                                </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> C：确保对产品待办事项列表进行适当的优先排序，以避免产生排斥的依赖关系。Assure that the product backlog is properly prioritized to avoid dependencies that cause rejection.                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> D：创建一个专用的冲刺，以完成以前冲刺中所有未完成的规范。Create a dedicated sprint to complete all of the pending specifications from previous sprints.                                    </li>                            </ul>
                        </div>

                    </div><div class="st_content_txt">
                        <div class="st_content_txt_tm" id="147350">
                            <span>133、</span>
                            <em>[单选]</em>

                        <div class="st_content_txt_xx">
                            <ul>

                                        <input type="radio" checked=""> A：与团队一起检查待办事项列表，并创建能够向客户交付增量价值的小型迭代。Meet with the team to review the backlog and create small iterations that can deliver incremental value to the client.                                                                                </li><li>

                    </div><div class="st_content_txt">
                        <div class="st_content_txt_tm" id="147351">
                            <span>134、</span>
                            <em>[单选]</em>
                            一个公司正在将它的项目从预测方法转变为迭代方法。项目团队有所抱怨，因为产品负责人要求对项目开始以来已经开发的所有功能进行变更，他们不确定需要做什么。项目经理应该如何处理这种情况？A company is transitioning its projects from a predictive to an iterative approach.                         <div class="st_content_txt_xx">
                            <ul>
                                <li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> A：要求产品负责人在风险管理计划中创建一个关于可能性和阻碍的新条目。Require the product owner to create a new entry in the risk management plan regarding possibilities and obstacles.                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> B：审查类似项目的待办事项列表，了解变更请求是如何实施的。Review the backlogs from similar projects and understand how change requests were implemented.                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> C：要求产品负责人遵循变更请求流程，以正式确定新需求。Ask the product owner to follow the change request process to formalize new requirements.                                    </li><li>

                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_answer">

                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_jx_txt">

                    </div><div class="st_content_txt">
                        <div class="st_content_txt_tm" id="147352">

                        <div class="st_content_txt_xx">
                            <ul>

                                        <input type="radio" checked=""> A：与干系人会面，利用项目目标和预期结果来确定方法。Meet with the stakeholders to determine the approach using the project goals and desired outcomes.                                                                                </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> B：只有当项目与可以被分解为增量的软件实施相关时，才能利用敏捷方法。 Leverage agile methods only as the project pertains to software implementation, which can be broken into increments.                                    </li><li>

                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_answer">

                            一个重要的客户干系人要求项目团队在待办事项列表中包含新的任务，并开始分析新的请求。客户希望尽快得到结果，并要求团队参加非关键的会议。团队因为这种情况而感到沮丧。项目经理应该如何处理这种情况？A key customer stakeholder asks the project team to include new tasks in the backlog and begin analyzing new requests. The customer expects results as soon as possible and pressures the team to attend noncritical meetings. The team is frustrated by this situation. How should the project manager approach this situation?                        </div>
                        <div class="st_content_txt_xx">
                            <ul>
                                <li>
                                        <input type="radio" checked=""> A：理解客户的观点，并提供敏捷思维的指导。Understand the customer's perspective and provide mentoring on agile mindsets.                                                                                </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> B：召集内部团队回顾并制定改进行动计划。Call for an internal team retrospective and create an improvement action plan.                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> C：请客户与产品负责人合作，确定所有请求的优先级。Ask the customer to work with the product owner to prioritize all requests.                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> D：与团队合作，接受客户指示并改进流程。Work with the team to receive customer directions and improve the process.                                    </li>                            </ul>
                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_answer">
                            <span>正确答案：<span class="answer_right">A</span></span>
                            <span>你的答案：<span class="answer_wrong">A</span></span>
                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_jx_txt">
                            解析：选A，题目描述的是客户要求团队立即处理新的请求，应该先让客户理解敏捷的工作方式和理念，尤其是在需求变更和优先级确定的处理上。选项C在A之后，新的需求或任务应该添加到产品待办事项列表中，产品负责人有责任管理待办事项列表并确定优先级。                                                    </div>
                    </div><div class="st_content_txt">
                        <div class="st_content_txt_tm" id="147391">
                            <span>174、</span>
                            <em>[单选]</em>
                            一个新的市场副总裁刚加入一家软件创业公司，并对敏捷模式没有提供他们在职责方面所需的问责制感到担忧。作为负责的项目经理，应该采取什么措施来确保副总裁对项目的达成协议感到满意？A new marketing vice president just joined a software startup and is concerned that the agile model does not provide the needed accountability for their role. What should the responsible project manager do to ensure the vice president is comfortable with the project meeting its agreements?                        </div>
                        <div class="st_content_txt_xx">
                            <ul>
                                <li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> A：要求市场副总裁对所有需求进行适当批准，并正式记录这些协议。Require proper approval of all requirements from the marketing vice president and formally document the agreements.                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> B：培养一种开放沟通的环境，让各方能够讨论问题并达成共识。Foster an environment of open communication where all parties can discuss issues andagree on objectives.                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> C：建立一个高级审查委员会，使所有干系人能够讨论和批准功能和需求。Establish an executive review board where aIl stakeholders discuss and approve features and requirements.                                    </li><li>
                                        <input type="radio" checked=""> D：充分利用与副总裁的评审/演示会议，以确认已达成协议。Leverage the use of the review/demo sessions with the vice president to acknowledge that the agreements were met.                                                                                </li>                            </ul>
                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_answer">

                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_jx_txt">
                            解析：D最佳，在敏捷项目中，评审/展示会议可以让干系人看到已经完成的工作，并及时提供反馈，能帮助提供副总裁寻求的责任感。选项B在任何项目中都很重要，它没有解决副总裁对敏捷环境中责任感的关注。                                                    </div>
                    </div><div class="st_content_txt">

The risk register continues to grow, but only a few impediments have been mitigated. What should the project manager do?                        </div>
                        <div class="st_content_txt_xx">
                            <ul>
                                <li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> A：识别可能影响项目的任何关键障碍。Identify any critical impediments that may affect the project.                                    </li><li>
                                        <input type="radio" checked=""> B：要求项目团队解决这些障碍。Ask the project team to resolve the impediments.                                                                                </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> C：停止开发直到所有障碍都被解决。Stop development until all impediments are resolved.                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> D：与发起人讨论如何消除这些障碍。Discuss how to remove the impediments with the sponsor.                                    </li>                            </ul>
                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_answer">

                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_jx_txt">

                        <div class="st_content_txt_xx">
                            <ul>
                                <li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> A：关注重要事项。Focusing on the important things.                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> B：维护团队精神和合作。Maintaining team spirit and cooperation.                                    </li><li>
                                        <input type="radio" checked=""> C：拥有一个系统化的视野。Having a holistic and systemic view.                                                                                </li><li>
                                                                                    <input type="radio" disabled=""> D：确保期望清晰明了。Ensuring that expectations are clear.                                    </li>                            </ul>
                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_answer">

What three corrective actions should the project manager take? (Choose three)                        </div>
                        <div action="" class="st_content_txt_xx">
                            <ul>
                                <li>
                                        <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" checked="" disabled=""> A： 直接面对造成压力的人，以找到友好的解决办法。Confront the people causing the stress directly with the aim of finding amicable solutions.   </div>
                                                                                </li><li>
                                        <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" checked="" disabled=""> B： 就处理影响项目的问题向项目管理办公室寻求协助。Seek support from the project management office (PMO) on addressing issues affecting the project.   </div>
                                                                                </li><li>
                                        <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" checked="" disabled=""> C： 与项目发起人讨论可能采取的行动。Discuss the possible actions with the project sponsor.   </div>
                                                                                </li><li>
                                                                                    <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" disabled=""> D： 避免给人带来压力，并尽快要求调任。Avoid the people causing stress and request a transfer as soon as possible. </div>                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" disabled=""> E： 和人力资源经理谈谈这些问题。Talk to the human resources (HR) manager about these concerns. </div>                                    </li>                            </ul>
                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_answer">

                        </div>

                        <div class="jxxq_jx_txt">

                    </div><div class="st_content_txt">
                        <div class="st_content_txt_tm" id="147395">
                            <span>2、</span>

During the third sprint, the project manager notices that the team is not working as a cohesive unit. Which two rules are appropriate for the project manager to instill in the team? (Choose two)                        </div>
                        <div action="" class="st_content_txt_xx">
                            <ul>
                                <li>
                                        <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" checked="" disabled=""> A： 努力持续改进。Strive toward continuous improvement.   </div>
                                                                                </li><li>
                                        <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" checked="" disabled=""> B： 每天以团队形式一起工作。Work together daily as a team.   </div>
                                                                                </li><li>
                                                                                    <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" disabled=""> C： 只在冲刺结束时分享建议。Only share suggestions at the end of the sprint. </div>                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" disabled=""> D： 遵循冲刺计划。Follow the sprint planning. </div>                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" disabled=""> E： 向整个团队发送通信。Send communications to the entire team. </div>                                    </li>                            </ul>
                        </div>
                        <div class="jxxq_answer">

                        </div>
                    <!--    <div class="jxxq_jx_txt">
                            解析：敏捷实践指南，2.2-《敏捷宣言》及思维模式，P8。选项A正确，努力实现持续改进：鼓励团队定期反思他们如何变得更有效，然后相应地调整他们的行为。选项B正确，项目实施过程中，业务人员与开发人员必须始终通力协作。选项D，虽然sprint计划是敏捷方法的一个重要方面，但它不是灌输给团队以提高凝聚力的规则，凝聚力更多的是关于团队互动、协作和相互尊重。                        </div>-->

                        <div class="jxxq_jx_txt">
                            解析：敏捷实践指南，2.2-《敏捷宣言》及思维模式，P8。选项A正确，努力实现持续改进：鼓励团队定期反思他们如何变得更有效，然后相应地调整他们的行为。选项B正确，项目实施过程中，业务人员与开发人员必须始终通力协作。选项D，虽然sprint计划是敏捷方法的一个重要方面，但它不是灌输给团队以提高凝聚力的规则，凝聚力更多的是关于团队互动、协作和相互尊重。                                                    </div>

The project manager is afraid that it may impact the project's success.Which two actions can the project manager do to resolve this issue? (Choose two)                        </div>
                        <div action="" class="st_content_txt_xx">
                            <ul>
                                <li>
                                        <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" checked="" disabled=""> A： 促进干系人参与，以改善沟通。Foster stakeholder engagement in order to improve communication.   </div>
                                                                                </li><li>
                                                                                    <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" disabled=""> B： 与项目发起人讨论这个问题，以便有效处理。Discuss the issue with the project sponsor in order to handle it efficiently. </div>                                    </li><li>
                                        <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" checked="" disabled=""> C： 分享项目目标，确保它们被正确理解。Share the project objectives to ensure they are properly digested.   </div>

                                                                                    <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" disabled=""> D： 坚持面对面会议，以了解真正的担忧。Insist on face-to-face meetings in order to understand the real concerns. </div>                                    </li><li>
                                                                                    <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" disabled=""> E： 按原计划进行，因为这种情况在大型项目中很常见。Proceed as planned as these situations are quite common in large projects. </div>                                    </li>                            </ul>

                        <div class="jxxq_answer">

                        <div class="jxxq_jx_txt">

                    </div><div class="st_content_txt">

                                <li>

                                                                                </li><li>
                                                                                    <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" disabled=""> B： 向团队发送包含详细任务进度的电子邮件Send the team an email with detailed task progress. </div>                                    </li><li>

                                                                                </li><li>
                                                                                    <div class="st_xx_txt"><input type="checkbox" disabled=""> D： 将工作重新分配给参与日常通话的资源Reassign the work to a resource who participates in daily calls. </div>                                    </li><li>

                        <div class="jxxq_jx_txt">

<script type="text/javascript" src="/static/tools/layer/layer.js"></script>
<!-- jQuery -->
<script>

	// 修改图片到题干末尾
	$('.st_content_txt_tm').each(function(i){
		var numa =  $('.st_content_txt_tm').eq(i).attr('id');
		$('img').css({"display":"block","margin-left": "20px",});
		$('#'+numa).append($('#'+numa).find("img"));
	});

    $(function () {
        var winHeight = $(window).height();
        var navHeight = $('.fmy_head_wrap').height();
        var courseHeight = $('.stxq_mbx').height();
        var conHeight = $('.stxq_banner').height();
        var footHeight = $('.footer_warp').height();
        var pad = 150;
        $('.st_content_left').css('min-height', winHeight - navHeight - courseHeight - conHeight - footHeight - 150 + 'px');

        //根据类型进行锚点跳转
        var url = "/Test/alsTyper/tid/6447470/typer/1/write/176/lid/0.html#radio_anchor";
        if (url) {
            window.location.href = "/Test/alsTyper/tid/6447470/typer/1/write/176/lid/0.html#radio_anchor";
        }
        var type = "1";
        //选中当期类型
        $('.typer').each(function (i, v) {
            if (i + 1 == type) {
                $(v).addClass('current');
                return false;
            }
        });

        //点击切换类型
        $('.stxq_banner ul li').click(function () {
            $('.stxq_banner ul li').removeClass('current');
            $(this).addClass('current');
        });

        //处理video
        $('video').attr('controlslist', 'nodownload');
        $('video').attr('poster', "https://img01.aura.cn/wx/manage/defset/2018/2018-09/20180913090837_78838_288x152.jpg");
        $('video').css('display', 'block');
        $('video').css('margin', '0 auto');

        //处理右击
        $('body').attr('oncontextmenu', 'window.event.returnValue=false');
    });

    //屏幕滚动右侧板块固定
    window.onscroll = function () {
        var sc = $(document);
        var leftOf = $('.st_content').offset().left;
        var mbxHeight = $('.stxq_mbx').height();
        var topNum = mbxHeight + 279;
        if (sc.scrollTop() >= topNum) {  //当滚动距离大于250px时执行下面的东西
            $('.st_content_right').css({
                'position': 'fixed',
                'top': 0,
                'left': leftOf + 880,
                'z-index': '9999'
            });
        } else {//当滚动距离小于250的时候执行下面的内容，也就是让导航栏恢复原状
            $('.st_content_right').css({
                'position': 'static',
            });
        }
    }

    //播放解析视频
    function playVideo(aliVid) {
        if (!aliVid) {
            layer.msg('缺少参数，请刷新后重试~', {icon: 0, time: 1500});
            return false;
        }

        $.ajax({
            url: "/Test/ajaxGetPlayAuth.html",
            data: {aliVid: aliVid},
            type: 'post',
            dataType: 'json',
            success: function (data) {
                if (data.status) {
                    $('.video-box').css('display', 'block');

                    var html = "<div id = 'J_prismPlayer' style='width: 100%;height: 100%;' class='prism-player'></div>";
                    html += "<img class='J_prismPlayer_t' src='/static/home/images/video_x.png' onclick='closeVideo()'>";
                    $('#j_player').empty().append(html);

                    var configs = {
                        id: "J_prismPlayer",
                        //autoplay: true,
                        vid: aliVid,
                        playauth: data.data,
                        encryptType: 1,
                    };

                    var playerObj = new Aliplayer(configs, function (player) {
                    });
                } else {
                    layer.msg(data.msg, {icon: 2, time: 1500});
                    return false;
                }
            }
        });
    }
    //关闭视频
    function closeVideo() {
        $('.video-box').css('display', 'none');
        $('#J_prismPlayer').empty();
    }
</script>

</body></html>
